dublin_core.dcvalue: Tobacco use is the second cause of death and first cause of preventable mortality worldwide Smoking in the workplace is particularly concerning Smoking free workplaces decrease the risk of exposure of non smoking personnel to cigarette smoke Recent studies have mostly focused on the effect of daily or non occupational stressors in comparison with occupational stress on prevalence of smoking Occupational stress is often evaluated in workplaces for smoking cessation or control programs but the role of non occupational stressors is often disregarded in this respect
Relationship of occupational and non-occupational stress with smoking in automotive industry workers.
